meanings.definition: To undergo a gradual transformation or change in form
meanings.sent1: The caterpillar will morph into a butterfly.
meanings.sent2: Over time, the tadpole will morph into a frog.
meanings.sent3: It's like watching a magic trick as the pumpkin morphs into a carriage.
meanings.sent4: The city skyline seemed to morph into a beautiful painting at sunset.
meanings.sent5: The old house began to morph into a modern masterpiece after the renovation.

meanings.definition: A distinct, continuous shape or form
meanings.sent1: The cloud had a unique morph that resembled a dragon.
meanings.sent2: The artist carefully sculpted the clay into a perfect morph.
meanings.sent3: The cake had an unusual morph that made it look like a giant cupcake.
meanings.sent4: The shadows cast by the trees created a morph on the ground that looked like a forest.
meanings.sent5: The crystal had a beautiful morph that sparkled in the sunlight.

meanings.definition: A sequence of images that transition smoothly into each other
meanings.sent1: The movie used impressive morphs to show the character's transformation.
meanings.sent2: The presentation included a morph of the company logo evolving over time.
meanings.sent3: The slideshow had a funny morph where a cat turned into a lion.
meanings.sent4: The artist created a stunning morph of a flower blooming in stop motion.
meanings.sent5: The video game featured seamless morphs between different character animations.
